attributes.action: Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%
attributes.background: We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards. As a company they are awful they don’t care about the customer they care about profits. Let’s get TransPennine operating the northern lines

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to leave dogs chained up outside for hours on end.
attributes.background: Imagine being chained up, especially in extreme weather conditions such as hot sun, rain and freezing temperatures. It's not the way you would treat a human being, so why do people treat dogs like this? They need the basic needs like food, warmth, shelter and love.
attributes.additional_details: I have grown up with dogs all my life, most of them rescued from homes that don't care for them properly or they're surplus to requirement. In Pennsylvania, USA, they have just passed "Libre's Law", which prosecutes owners for leaving their dogs chained outside under certain conditions. For more information: http://www.philly.com/philly/news/animal-cruelty-pennsylvania-libres-law-20170628.html?mobi=true

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks after 5th November.
attributes.background:
I appreciate that Bonfire Night is going to be celebrated each and every year with fireworks, without fail. However, a lot of people and animals become extremely distressed during this time. 
Fireworks going on for weeks after Bonfire Night is completely unnecessary.

attributes.action: Lower the abortion time frame from 24 weeks to 23 weeks.
attributes.background: The 23-week survival rate in England and Wales was 23 per cent in 2010, and in 2014, the latest year for which data is available, 33 per cent of babies born at 23 weeks reached their first birthday. The figure is continuously rising due to medical advances.

attributes.action: Increase the Speed Limit on motorways between 11pm and 6am to 80 mph for cars.
attributes.background: During the night the motorway network is used less. Vehicles are now much better equipped with safety features to travel faster. Increasing the speed limit at night will encourage more travelling at this time and less congestion during the day. It would promote quicker and safer travelling at night.
attributes.additional_details: The National Speed Limit of 70mph on motorways was first introduced on a trial basis in 1965 and became permanent in 1967. The current 70mph limit has now been in place for over 50 years.

attributes.action: Fit all Heavy or Large Vehicles with Automatic Emergency Braking System (AEBS)
attributes.background: Horrific HGV accidents happen constantly. Automatic emergency braking systems could prevent many deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Humans are subject to fatigue, 'highway hypnosis', sudden medical problems and distractions. Automatic emergency brakes are not subject to any of these problems. According to Campaign For Better Transport: More than half (52%) of fatal accidents on motorways involve HGVs but only 10% of motorway vehicles are HGVs. HGVs are also involved in 1 in 5 fatal crashes on A and minor roads, and its worsening each year. Let's reverse this trend and use technology to prevent more deaths.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from riding two abreast.
attributes.background: Driving through the Yorkshire Dales is quite a frustrating experience - driving behind 20 cyclists for miles with about 50 cars trying to pass. Impossible.

attributes.action: Ban mobile operators from taking payments for phone purchases you've paid off.
attributes.background: Monthly payments for a new mobile contract will often include the service charges and a cost to cover a new phone. Once your contract term expires, and if you do not contact the operator, you will automatically continue paying the same monthly cost despite having paid off the loan for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is the same as buying a new car on finance and being expected to continue your payments once the loan is paid off. 

The majority of consumers may be aware of the practice and renegotiate their contracts, however, many others do not realise that part of their monthly cost is effectively a loan for the phone. 

Standard industry practice should be to automatically move consumers to SIM only when their contract expires or phone is paid off, whichever occurs first.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: Force the Government to fully fund the RNLI
attributes.background: in Britain we are one of the few countries that do not fund the Royal National lifeboat Association  and it is a scandal that we have to donate to something that should be provided as a government funded service.
attributes.additional_details: I was recently told by a lifeboat crew member that the service costs about £160m a year to finance, this is a a tiny amount when you look at government spending on say consultants, why are we allowing this travesty to continue.

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Stop non-UK residents donating money to UK political lobby groups.
attributes.background: Soros and others have their own agenda. People who don’t live in the UK should not be allowed to influence British politics by donating funds to lobby groups.

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who can’t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and won’t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldn’t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldn’t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under £1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted £80 a month.

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Leave the MOT tests for all vehicles the same and remove future changes.
attributes.background: I’m writing this petition to raise the thoughts on the up coming changes for the MOT tests towards vehicles. This is to raise the thoughts of others that don’t believe the changes are fair and that these changes are going to have a large effect on vehicles and history.

attributes.action: Divert the money used for foreign aid to fund the NHS as a temporary measure.
attributes.background:
Diverting overseas aid may seem wrong but we have many UK citizens of many ethnic backgrounds who are suffering because of lack of funding to the NHS and many of our citizens are dying needlessly.
The aid funding can be restored once we have put the NHS back on a proper footing.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Bradwell Nuclear Plant
attributes.background: This area is perfect for renewal energy, wind farms, solar.  Nuclear is totally unnecessary. Renewable energy is the way forward if designed to be used by the UK and not sold off.

attributes.action: charge people who need an ambulance or hospital care due to excessive drinking.
attributes.background:
Hospital admissions – narrow measure
There were 339 thousand estimated admissions related to alcohol consumption in 2015/16. This is 3% higher than 2014/15 and 22% higher than 2005/06.
This represents 2.1% of all hospital admissions which has changed little in the last 10 years.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS resorses would be better spent on people who really need it rather than self inflicted drunkenness. How may people have died as a result of an ambulance or hospital bed not being available because of irresponsible people excessively drinking.
If people can afford to get drunk they can afford the cost of recovering from it.

attributes.action: Any NEWSPAPER to be bound like BBC: to be fair, balanced, truthful and accurate.
attributes.background: At top of cover page, all publications to declare themselves to be a Newspaper, or Propaganda Sheet, Party Political publication, Advertising material, Lifestyle magazine, Specific Interest Publication. We need to know what we buy, just as we differentiate between reportage and advertisement.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this need is the existence of daily publications which:
•	deliberately distort their reporting by selection of facts, 
•	selectively headline items with a disproportionate emphasis on some topics, 
•	repeat items as if they were new or current when they are not, 
•	use biased, inflammatory or pejorative language, 
•	set a tone which encourages divisiveness and prejudice against particular groups or beliefs.
This is a serious and growing problem, today and in recent years.

attributes.action: NHS to stop supplying paracetamol on prescriptions and hospital discharges
attributes.background: I believe that paracetamol, ibuprofen and other over the counter items shouldn’t be supplied at a cost to the NHS when they can be bought for as little as 16p from Tesco and other retail stores. I believe the UK public should realise how much this costs the NHS

attributes.action: Make banks reduce affordability criteria for mortgages for first time buyers.
attributes.background:
Affordability criteria with banks is currently around 3-4 times salary with adjustments for expenses. 

Even with Help-to-Buy, a person on the current living wage would have a £30,000 deficit on the 75% mortgage they would need to afford a £150,000 property.
attributes.additional_details:
The current affordability criteria makes it impossible for a single person to afford their own home. 

Banks are still making large profits, yet they seem unwilling to increase their risk in order help hardworking people afford their own place to live. 

Using mortgage calculators for a required amount, buyers see amounts which they feel they could afford, yet the affordability criteria excludes them from applying. 

This petition proposes banks meet the 75% regardless of salary for Help-to-Buy.

attributes.action: To move Parliament to new buildings more suitable for 21st century Britain
attributes.background: To look at building a new Houses of Parliament, more suitable for a 21st century Britain, that shows clearly, MPs are public servants, elected by the people, to serve the people. The current premises are alien to a modern, successful country
attributes.additional_details: The current Houses of Parliament will make a fantastic British historic building to open up for the public, will pay for itself in visitors and events.

attributes.action: Make a Mother Earth Rights Act
attributes.background: Follow the example of Bolivia and Ecuador, make a law which gives Mother Earth, trees and creatures legal personage. This would help lawyers to better advocate on behalf of nature- this would have been particularly useful in the case of Sheffields street trees and against fracking in beauty spots.
attributes.additional_details: Review the Universal declaration of the rights of mother earth (Cochabamba, Bolivia, 22 April) and impliment some of the legal protections into UK law. To give stronger protection to the environment and to forfil UK obligations to the Convention of Biological Diversity.

attributes.action: Bring back vehicle tax discs
attributes.background: The number of unlicensed vehicles on the road has tripled since the paper tax disc was abolished. Government figures point to lost revenue of £107m from 755,000 unlicensed vehicles last year. Scrapping the tax disc was meant to save £10m a year, but it failed. The government needs to do a u-turn.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-42009111 for more background

attributes.action: Make flashing front and/or rear lights on pedal bicycles illegal.
attributes.background: I am a professional driver. In the last couple of years there has been a rise to epidemic proportion of pushbikes on the roads which are displaying flashing lights. Some of which are so intense that they actually cause serious discomfort and distraction to other road users. These lights are a danger
attributes.additional_details: If every road user were to have a constantly flashing light then there would be many accidents as a result. Also with the advances in LED technology even those front lights which do not flash are blinding if the beam is set at an incorrect angle. People should have compulsory education regarding safe use of pushbikes.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone £60+

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Stop charging married women to have their surname changed on their passport
attributes.background: When people get married and wish to take their partners surname the UK government charges to have their surname changed. This discriminates against marriage and women in particular as it is normally this sex which takes the surname of their partner. The charge should be eliminated or greatly reduced

attributes.action: Tighten the regulations on who can give Botox
attributes.background:
At the moment anyone can administer Botox after it has been prescribed.
I think only medical professionals should be able to administer Botox into clients.
e.g. Doctors, surgeons, dentists and nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently had a procedure done by an unqualified person who then left my face drooping down and paralysed.  I am one of many women who have suffered.  
Botox is a controlled substance this has to be prescribed by a doctor dentist or nurse prescriber.  At the moment who injects the Botox after this can be any one with no medical background. The dangers of this can be blindness , paralysed muscles and anaphylactic shock which can be fatal.

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use,  I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves.
attributes.additional_details: Graves have already been overfilled at New Southgate and City of London cemetery (see https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/06/re-using-graves-means-uk-cemetery-will-never-run-out-of-space), are currently been threatened at Camberwell Cemetery and shortly so at Manor park cemetery

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to search students' phones without consent.
attributes.background: Ever since 2011 it has been legal for teachers to search through students’ phones without the consent of the student. Students are human as well, and just because we are on school grounds does not mean we should lose our rights - unconsented searches are a complete violation of our rights to privacy
attributes.additional_details: Teachers can search through student’s phones with little more information than someone saying something to the teacher. This is completely ridiculous and happened recently at a school - where boys were forced to hand over their phones for the teacher to go through, despite the fact that what the teacher was insinuating had not happened and they had no more evidence to go through the phone other than a meaningless accusation. This is a violation of our privacy - and should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Work with the devolved Governments to build a bridge between Scotland and NI.
attributes.background:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-42772343

"Prof Alan Dunlop thinks the "Celtic bridge" would cost about £15bn, a fraction of the estimate of £120bn for the English Channel bridge."

"He said it would boost both economies and help the post-Brexit border issue."
attributes.additional_details:
"The business potential is exceptional, the chance of actually really making an investment in what would be the true north."

"We share a lot of history together, similar ideals."

"It would send out a dramatic marker in aspiration for the country going into the 21st Century."

"We do have incredibly talented architects and engineers in Scotland so I am sure that as a technical challenge it wouldn't be insurmountable."

Work with NI Assembly and Scottish Government to build a bridge

attributes.action: Justice for Zainab! Put pressure on the Pakistani government to act on rape.
attributes.background: Zainab is a 7 year old girl who was abducted when on her way to her Islamic lessons. She was raped and murdered and left in a pile of rubbish. Her parents were away on Ummrah when this had happened. Action needs to be taken! Pressure needs to be put on the Pakistani government to take rape seriously
attributes.additional_details: Put pressure on the government to introduce sexual abuse awareness to children! What is appropriate and what is not.

attributes.action: Debate the relevance of the Right to Buy legislation
attributes.background: Because of the increasing number of homeless families/single people, this request asks that Parliament debates the relevancy of the Right to Buy legislation, considering whether by revoking it thereby leaving more homes under Council control the numbers of homeless might decrease.
attributes.additional_details: I recently saw a discussion on the television where the particular Council responding to a question concerning their inability to house homeless families/single people said that for every three properties they built, two others of their stock went for 'right to buy'. I know little of the problems of Councils housing people nor of the Right to Buy Legislation but it seems to me possible that those that introduced the legislation may not have anticipated todays number of homeless.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists filtering on blind side and apply 1.5m rule in all cases
attributes.background: Cyclist's are putting themselves in danger passing through tiny gaps on blind side where they are not seen by motorists and should abide by the 1.5m passing rule to avoid causing dangerous road conditions and damage to vehicles where cyclists aren't insured

attributes.action: Pets in pet shops need to be in bigger and better tanks/cages. It’s just cruel.
attributes.background: Everyday you see rodents, such as hamsters, cavies, rabbits just stuck in tiny glass cages with little to no movement...and it is awful. I’d really like the legal cage requirements to be doubled as it breaks my heart seeing them in that condition

attributes.action: Ban private parking firms from operating within the NHS.
attributes.background: I recently had to spend a lot of time visiting my ill mother in hospital. It opened my eyes to the fact so many people have huge worries regarding parking to see to their loved ones as the cost is so high. The worst bit about it is not a penny was going back into the hospital but to a private firm.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website states:
Charges should be reasonable for the area.
Concessions, including free or reduced charges or caps, should be available for the following groups:
Disabled people
Frequent outpatient attenders
Visitors with relatives who are gravely ill, or carers of such people
Visitors to relatives who have an extended stay in hospital, or carers of such people
Carers of people in the above groups where appropriate.
My recent visits of £18 per day is certainly not within these guidelines.

attributes.action: Don't put down Army dogs because they can't be re-homed. We owe a duty of care
attributes.background:
Two hero Army dogs which helped save thousands of lives on duty in Afghanistan are to be put down because they can't be re-homed, it has been reported.
Ex soldiers and dog handlers who worked with the Belgian Shepherds are said to have written to a Defence chief demanding the decision be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
“This is such a cruel way to treat these animals that have given us so much.
“People who worked closely with these dogs are devastated at the plans — they’ve begged to save them all.
"Experienced handlers have come forward to say they want to house the much-loved dogs, who have helped save hundreds of lives. 
In 2012, The Mirror reported how 807 of our much-loved military dogs had been destroyed by the Army over the past decade despite years of faithful service.
Daily Mirror online 1/12.17

attributes.action: Create a body to mediate between Insolvency Practioners and those in an IVA.
attributes.background: An IVA typically lasts 5 or 6 years and the debtor  must use the services of an Insolvency Practitioner (IP). Once signed up they are bound to that IP, regardless of quality of service. they have no access to mediation. See https://www.iva.co.uk/forum/another-petition-f145-t83980 for background.
attributes.additional_details: Where there is a dispute between a creditor and debtor, the debtor can turn to the Financial Ombudsman for mediation / resolution. However, in an IVA there is no mechanism for mediation / resolution. The debtor has to rely on the insolvency firms complaints procedure and then the IP’s regulatory body.  BUT … the regulatory bodies do not intervene. They will not alter or make an IP alter their course of action, even if proven incorrect. The debtor gets no restitution nor is the dispute settled

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all new vehicles to be fitted with a tracking device
attributes.background: Car theft is rising in the UK with the vast majority being uninvestigsted by the police either though budget cuts or lack of evidence. This is why all new vehicles sold in the UK should be factory fitted with a tracking device. This will make car theft a thing of the past.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.easier.com/93725-stolen-cars-fitted-tracker-recovered.html

http://eb-iaati.org/news/entry/uk_chance_of_getting_your_stolen_car_back_drops_to_less_than_50_per_cent

attributes.action: Make it Legal where ‘Footballs’ are Being Kicked into Gardens can be Kept in Law
attributes.background: At this time the Law states that Balls must be returned which is Stupid as they just Repeat their actions causing Damage to Plants and Property, they never Learn but the Loss would stop there actions, this can be from the Highway as Well as joining Gardens, there are Play Areas made for Football.
attributes.additional_details: The Police fail to uphold the Law from the Highways using section 161 item 3, Parents and their Children need to Learn either the easy way which they control or the hard way where they loose the Balls, we have had over Fifty balls over now with Nobody doing anything, cars damaged and garden lights smashed, the wife being hit in the face plus many other Antisocial things, the Police should not take their side and threaten Prosecution if house owners keep the Balls, Let’s put the issue correct Now

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: Action an effective NHS care pathway for patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is an inherited connective tissue abnormality.People with EDS have no care within the NHS. Healthcarer's have no access to formal training, forcing patients to self fund private care with the few specialists available, in order to manage their multiple,painful & life threatening disabilities.
attributes.additional_details:
EDS UK and the Royal College of GP's are working together to improve education on EDS and to create a 'toolkit' for GP's managing patients with the condition. (https://www.ehlers-danlos.org/news/spotlight/). 

At present, patients like myself are forced to fundraise for urgent and long term care to manage disabilities, extreme pain, dislocations, and at times life saving surgeries abroad. No specialist area has claimed the condition leaving GP's unaware of who to refer patients to for their care

attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening
attributes.background: There are often no symptoms of prostate cancer until it has spread and its too late to cure. Many lives could be saved and it would save the NHS a fortune in expensive treatments.

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10
